fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.processors.interfaces

Interface ProcessorServicesI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.ComponentImplementedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.RequiredI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProcessorServicesConnector, ProcessorServicesInboundPort, ProcessorServicesOutboundPort

    public interface ProcessorServicesI
extends fr.upmc.components.interfaces.OfferedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.RequiredI
    The interface ProcessorServicesI defines the functional services of a processor, such as running a task on a given core.

    Description

    The method executeTaskOnCore runs a given task on a given core.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : January 19, 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void executeTaskOnCore(TaskI t, int coreNo)
      execute a task on a given core.
      void executeTaskOnCoreAndNotify(TaskI t, int coreNo, java.lang.String notificationPortURI)
      execute a task on a given core and notify the end of the task through a port which URI is given.

    • Method Detail

      • executeTaskOnCore

        void executeTaskOnCore(TaskI t,
                       int coreNo)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        execute a task on a given core.

        Contract

         pre    t != null && isValidCoreNo(coreNo)
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        t - task to be executed.
        coreNo - number of the core on which t must be executed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • executeTaskOnCoreAndNotify

        void executeTaskOnCoreAndNotify(TaskI t,
                                int coreNo,
                                java.lang.String notificationPortURI)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        execute a task on a given core and notify the end of the task through a port which URI is given. The port which URI is given must implement the interface ProcessorServicesNotificationI.

        Contract

         pre    t != null && isValidCoreNo(coreNo) && notificationPortURI != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        t - task to be executed.
        coreNo - number of the core on which t must be executed.
        notificationPortURI - URI of the port to which the end of the task will be notified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
